column4: Well I know my ubuntu install is there, i just want to make it boot to it... how do i do that?
change the boot sequence in your BIOS unless you have it on the same hard drive as another OS
Boot sequence? You mean change which drive it checks the bootloader for?
Ah, and then I can change the other bootloader to boot to the first drive (windows).... right?
Yes. I grew up with Windows.
But Ive always preferred 2000 over XP...
well then the term "boot sequence" should be familiar
I grew up with windows, but ive done such geeky stuff with windows that I feel I should have started with linux...
same here. Linux is just so much easier and better.
For example, back when everyone ran 98, I ran the windows 95 shell on 98 just to make it more stable
well it was, which was how I understood you so quick, I'll try it
Nice. I was still running 95 when everyone went for 98 and 98SE
I woulda still ran 95 but games werent compatible with it anymore... you know microsoft
I am a huge fan of Microsoft, especially since Vista, but I'm not a fan of the huge monopoly they have made.
you're a fan of microsoft especially since vista? Vista blows chungs
not with a quad-core processor and running on my rig. ;)
